sen.j: 佐伯今毛人（さえきのいまえみし、養老3年（719年） - 延暦9年10月3日 (旧暦)（790年11月17日））は奈良時代の貴族。
sen.e: SAEKI no Imaemishi (719 - 17 November 790) was a noble who lived in the Nara Period.
SAEKI no Imaemishi (719 - 17 November 790) was a noble who lived in the Nara Period.
SAEKI no Imaemishi (719 - 17 November 790) was a noble who lived in the Nara Period.

sen.j: 今蝦夷とも表記する。
sen.e: His first name is also spelled as 今蝦夷.
His first name is also spelled as 今蝦夷.
His first name is also spelled as 今蝦夷.

sen.j: 初名は若子。
sen.e: He was first given the name Wakako.
He was first given the name Wakako.
He was first given the name Wakako.

sen.j: 右衛士督佐伯人足の子。
sen.e: He was a son of a Guard Chief, SAEKI no Hitotari.
He was a son of a Guard Chief, SAEKI no Hitotari.
He was a son of a Guard Chief, SAEKI no Hitotari.

sen.j: 兄に佐伯真守。
sen.e: His brother was SAEKI no Mamori.
His brother was SAEKI no Mamori.
His brother was SAEKI no Mamori.

sen.j: 正三位・参議。
sen.e: He was a Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) Councilor.
He was a Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) Councilor.
He was a Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) Councilor.

sen.j: 紫香楽宮造営司に主典として出向したのを皮切りに以後東大寺や西大寺 (奈良市)の造営、長岡京遷都の任に当たるなど主に建築や造営の面で活躍した。
sen.e: He gained a reputation in the field of architecture and construction by first starting off as a Sakan for the construction of Shigaraki no Miya Palace and later working on the construction of Todai-ji Temple and Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City), and the transfer of the national capital to Nagaoka.

He gained a reputation in the field of architecture and construction by first starting off as a Sakan for the construction of Shigaraki no Miya Palace and later working on the construction of Todai-ji Temple and Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City), and the transfer of the national capital to Nagaoka.

He gained a reputation in the field of architecture and construction by first starting off as a Sakan for the construction of Shigaraki no Miya Palace and later working on the construction of Todai-ji Temple and Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City), and the transfer of the national capital to Nagaoka.

sen.j: 特に東大寺造営における天皇の評価は高く異例の七階の特進をしている。
sen.e: The Emperor was impressed with the construction of Todai-ji Temple and promoted him seven ranks.
The Emperor was impressed with the construction of Todai-ji Temple and promoted him seven ranks.
The Emperor was impressed with the construction of Todai-ji Temple and promoted him seven ranks.

sen.j: 天平宝字7年（763年）今毛人は藤原良継、石上宅嗣、大伴家持らと、当時、太師（太政大臣）となり専横を極めていた恵美押勝（藤原仲麻呂）の暗殺を謀議するが、密告により露見。
sen.e: In 763, Imaemishi discussed the plan with FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu, ISONOKAMI no Yakatsugu and OTOMO no Yakamochi to assassinate tyrant Taishi (Grand Minister), EMI no Oshikatsu (FUJIWARA no Nakamaro); however, it did not succeed due to betrayal.

In 763, Imaemishi discussed the plan with FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu, ISONOKAMI no Yakatsugu and OTOMO no Yakamochi to assassinate the tyrant Taishi (Grand Minister), EMI no Oshikatsu (FUJIWARA no Nakamaro); however, it did not succeed due to betrayal.

In 763, Imaemishi discussed the plan with FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu, ISONOKAMI no Yakatsugu and OTOMO no Yakamochi to assassinate the tyrant Taishi (Grand Minister), EMI no Oshikatsu (FUJIWARA no Nakamaro); however, it did not succeed due to betrayal.

sen.j: 藤原良継が罪を一人で被ったため、今毛人は解官のみで助けられる。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu took the blame for other people, and therefore Imaemishi was only removed from his office.
FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu took the blame for other people, and therefore Imaemishi was only removed from his office.
FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu took the blame for other people, and therefore Imaemishi was only removed from his office.

sen.j: 恵美押勝は翌天平宝字8年（764年）に乱を起こして滅びている（藤原仲麻呂の乱）。
sen.e: EMI no Oshikatsu died in the war which he started in 764 (FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's War).
EMI no Oshikatsu died in the war which he started in 764 (FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's War).
EMI no Oshikatsu died in the war which he started in 764 (FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's War).

sen.j: 宝亀6年(775年)、第16次の遣唐使に任命される。
sen.e: Imaemishi was assigned as the 16th envoy to Tang Dynasty China in 775.
Imaemishi was assigned as the 16th envoy to Tang Dynasty China in 775.
Imaemishi was assigned as the 16th envoy to Tang Dynasty China in 775.

sen.j: 宝亀8年(777年)4月、節刀を賜り再度（前年は大宰府から引き返している）出発したが羅城門までくると病になり渡航を断念し摂津に留まることとなった。
sen.e: In April, 777, he received Setto (a sword given from the Emperor to the chief envoy) and departed (he only made it to Dazaifu last year); however, he became very sick near Rajo-mon Gate and gave up the mission and stayed in Settu.

In April, 777, he received Setto (a sword given from the Emperor to the chief envoy) and departed (he only made it to Dazaifu last year); however, he became very sick near Rajo-mon Gate and gave up the mission and stayed in Settu.

In April, 777, he received Setto (a sword given from the Emperor to the chief envoy) and departed (he only made it to Dazaifu last year); however, he became very sick near Rajo-mon Gate and gave up the mission and stayed in Settu.

sen.j: なお、この16次遣唐使は今毛人に代わって大使の任務を代行した副使小野石根と唐使趙宝英が乗船していた第1船が帰路遭難し両名は死亡している。
sen.e: Vice-envoy, ONO no Iwane was chosen for this ask instead of Imaemishi, and the ship which he and Chinese envoy, Homei Cho were on was wrecked on their way to Japan, and both died.
Vice-envoy, ONO no Iwane was chosen for this task instead of Imaemishi, and the ship which he and Chinese envoy, Homei Cho were on was wrecked on their way to Japan, and both died.
Vice-envoy, ONO no Iwane was chosen for this task instead of Imaemishi, and the ship which he and Chinese envoy, Homei Cho were on was wrecked on their way to Japan, and both died.

sen.j: 養老3年(719年) - 生誕。
sen.e: 719 - He was born.
719 - He was born.
719 - He was born.

sen.j: 初名は若子。
sen.e: His original name was Wakugo.
His original name was Wakugo.
His original name was Wakugo.

sen.j: 天平12年(740年) - 舎人となり出仕。
sen.e: 740 - He entered government service as Toneri (palace servant).
740 - He entered government service as Toneri (palace servant).
740 - He entered government service as Toneri (palace servant).

sen.j: 正八位下。
sen.e: He was promoted to Shohachiinoge (Lower Grade Senior Eighth Rank).
He was promoted to Shohachiinoge (Lower Grade Senior Eighth Rank).
He was promoted to Shohachiinoge (Lower Grade Senior Eighth Rank).

sen.j: 天平14年(742年) - 紫香楽宮造営司主典。
sen.e: 742 - He became a Sakan for the construction of Shigayaki no Miya Palace
742 - He became a Sakan for the construction of Shigayaki no Miya Palace
742 - He became a Sakan for the construction of Shigayaki no Miya Palace

sen.j: 天平17年(745年) - 従七位下。
sen.e: 745 - He was promoted to Jushichiinoge (Lower Grade Junior Seventh Rank).
745 - He was promoted to Jushichiinoge (Lower Grade Junior Seventh Rank).
745 - He was promoted to Jushichiinoge (Lower Grade Junior Seventh Rank).

sen.j: 天平18年(746年) - 従七位上。
sen.e: 746 - He was promoted to Jushichiinojo (Upper Grade Junior Seventh Rank).
746 - He was promoted to Jushichiinojo (Upper Grade Junior Seventh Rank).
746 - He was promoted to Jushichiinojo (Upper Grade Junior Seventh Rank).

sen.j: 天平19年(747年) - 今毛人に改名。
sen.e: 746 - He changed his name to Imaemishi.
746 - He changed his name to Imaemishi.
746 - He changed his name to Imaemishi.

sen.j: 天平20年(748年) - 造東大寺司次官。
sen.e: 748 - He became the Vice Officer of Todai-ji Temple Construction.
748 - He became the Vice Officer of Todai-ji Temple Construction.
748 - He became the Vice Officer of Todai-ji Temple Construction.

sen.j: 天平勝宝元年(749年) - 大倭介兼任。
sen.e: 748 - He held a concurrent position of 大倭介.
sen.cmt: 大倭介の読み、意味共に不明でした。
sen.e: 748 - He held a concurrent position of 大倭介.
748 - He held a concurrent position of 大倭介.

sen.j: 七階特進し従五位下。
sen.e: He was promoted seven ranks and became Jugoiinoge.
He was promoted seven ranks and became Jugoiinoge.
He was promoted seven ranks and became Jugoiinoge.

sen.j: 天平勝宝2年(750年) - 孝謙天皇東大寺へ行幸。
sen.e: 750 - Emperor Koken visited Todai-ji Temple.
750 - Emperor Koken visited Todai-ji Temple.
750 - Emperor Koken visited Todai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 正五位上。
sen.e: He was promoted to Shogoinojo (Upper Grade Senior Fifth Rank).
He was promoted to Shogoinojo (Upper Grade Senior Fifth Rank).
He was promoted to Shogoinojo (Upper Grade Senior Fifth Rank).

sen.j: 天平勝宝7歳(755年) - 造東大寺長官。
sen.e: 755 - He became the Director for the Construction of Todai-ji Temple.
755 - He became the Director for the Construction of Todai-ji Temple.
755 - He became the Director for the Construction of Todai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 天平宝字元年(757年) - 従四位下。
sen.e: 757 - He was promoted to Jushiinoge (Lower Grade Junior Fourth Rank).
757 - He was promoted to Jushiinoge (Lower Grade Junior Fourth Rank).
757 - He was promoted to Jushiinoge (Lower Grade Junior Fourth Rank).

sen.j: 天平宝字3年(759年) - 摂津国大夫。
sen.e: 759 - He became Daibu of Settu Province.
759 - He became Daibu of Settu Province.
759 - He became Daibu of Settu Province.

sen.j: 天平宝字7年(763年) - 造東大寺長官に再任。
sen.e: 763 - He was reappointed as the Director for the Construction of Todai-ji Temple.
763 - He was reappointed as the Director for the Construction of Todai-ji Temple.
763 - He was reappointed as the Director for the Construction of Todai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 同年藤原良継、石上宅嗣、大伴家持らと恵美押勝の暗殺を謀議し失敗したことにより解官。
sen.e: He was removed from the office due to the attempt to assassinate EMI no Oshikatsu with FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu, ISONOKAMI no Yakatsugu and OTOMO no Yakamoch in the same year.
He was removed from the office due to an attempt to assassinate EMI no Oshikatsu with FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu, ISONOKAMI no Yakatsugu and OTOMO no Yakamoch in the same year.
He was removed from the office due to an attempt to assassinate EMI no Oshikatsu with FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu, ISONOKAMI no Yakatsugu and OTOMO no Yakamoch in the same year.

sen.j: 天平宝字8年(764年) - 営城監に任じられ大宰府に赴任。
sen.e: 764 - He was assigned as Eijogen in Dazaifu.
764 - He was assigned as Eijogen in Dazaifu.
764 - He was assigned as Eijogen in Dazaifu.

sen.j: 同年肥前国国司兼任。
sen.e: He held a concurrent position of the Governor of Hizen Province in the same year.
He held a concurrent position as the Governor of Hizen Province in the same year.
He held a concurrent position as the Governor of Hizen Province in the same year.

sen.j: 天平神護元年(765年) - 大宰大弐に補任。
sen.e: 765 - He was appointed as Dazainodaini.
765 - He was appointed as Dazainodaini.
765 - He was appointed as Dazainodaini.

sen.j: 怡土城を築く専知官を兼ねる。
sen.e: He held a concurrent position of an advisor for the construction of Ito Castle.
He held a concurrent position of an advisor for the construction of Ito Castle.
He held a concurrent position of an advisor for the construction of Ito Castle.

sen.j: 神護景雲元年(767年) - 大宰府より帰京。
sen.e: 767 - He returned from Dazaifu.
767 - He returned from Dazaifu.
767 - He returned from Dazaifu.

sen.j: 造西大寺長官。
sen.e: He became the Director for the Construction of Zaidai-ji Temple.
He became the Director for the Construction of Zaidai-ji Temple.
He became the Director for the Construction of Zaidai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 同年弁官兼任。
sen.e: He held a concurrent position of Benkan (Oversight Department responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices) in the same year.
He held a concurrent position of Benkan (Oversight Department responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices) in the same year.
He held a concurrent position of Benkan (Oversight Department responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices) in the same year.

sen.j: 神護景雲3年(769年) - 因幡国守を兼任。
sen.e: 769 - He held a concurrent position of the Governor of Inaba Province.
769 - He held a concurrent position as the Governor of Inaba Province.
769 - He held a concurrent position as the Governor of Inaba Province.

sen.j: 同年、従四位上。
sen.e: He was promoted to Jushiijo (Upper Grade Junior Fourth Rank) the same year.
He was promoted to Jushiijo (Upper Grade Junior Fourth Rank) the same year.
He was promoted to Jushiijo (Upper Grade Junior Fourth Rank) the same year.

sen.j: 宝亀元年(770年) - 播磨国守を兼ねる。
sen.e: 770 - He held a concurrent position of the Governor of Harima Province.
770 - He held a concurrent position as the Governor of Harima Province.
770 - He held a concurrent position as the Governor of Harima Province.

sen.j: 同年、称徳天皇が崩御し天皇の寵愛深かった太政大臣禅師道鏡が失脚。
sen.e: In the same year, the Empress Shotoku who was in favor of Daijodaijinzenji Dokyo died, and it led to his downfall.
In the same year, the Empress Shotoku who was in favor of Daijodaijinzenji Dokyo died, and it led to his downfall.
In the same year, the Empress Shotoku who was in favor of Daijodaijinzenji Dokyo died, and it led to his downfall.

sen.j: 今毛人は道鏡を下野国薬師寺別当へ進発せしめる。
sen.e: Imaemish relegated Dokyo to the administrator of Yakushi-ji Temple of Shimotsuke Province.
Imaemish relegated Dokyo to the administrator of Yakushi-ji Temple of Shimotsuke Province.
Imaemish relegated Dokyo to the administrator of Yakushi-ji Temple of Shimotsuke Province.

sen.j: 同年、三たび造東大寺長官を兼ねる。
sen.e: He held a concurrent position of the Director for the Construction of Todai-ji Temple once again in the same year.
He held a concurrent position as the Director for the Construction of Todai-ji Temple once again in the same year.
He held a concurrent position as the Director for the Construction of Todai-ji Temple once again in the same year.

sen.j: 宝亀2年(771年) - 正四位下。
sen.e: 771 - He was promoted to Shoshiinoge (Lower Grade Senior Fourth Rank).
771 - He was promoted to Shoshiinoge (Lower Grade Senior Fourth Rank).
771 - He was promoted to Shoshiinoge (Lower Grade Senior Fourth Rank).

sen.j: 宝亀6年(775年) - 遣唐使に任命。
sen.e: 775 - He was assigned as an envoy to Tang Dynasty China.
775 - He was assigned as an envoy to Tang Dynasty China.
775 - He was assigned as an envoy to Tang Dynasty China.

sen.j: 宝亀7年(776年) - 4月、大使として節刀を賜り大宰府に行く。
sen.e: 776 - He received Setto (a swod given from the Emperor to the chief envoy) and headed to Dazaifu.
776 - He received Setto (a swod given from the Emperor to the chief envoy) and headed to Dazaifu.
776 - He received Setto (a swod given from the Emperor to the chief envoy) and headed to Dazaifu.

sen.j: 11月になって大宰府から都へ還り節刀を返上する。
sen.e: In November, he came back from Dazaifu and returned Setto to the Emperor.
In November, he came back from Dazaifu and returned Setto to the Emperor.
In November, he came back from Dazaifu and returned Setto to the Emperor.

sen.j: 宝亀8年(777年）- 4月、今毛人は再び節刀を賜り出発するが病のため摂津に滞留。
sen.e: April, 777 - Imaemishi received Setto once again and departed; however, he later became sick and stayed in Settu.
April, 777 - Imaemishi received Setto once again and departed; however, he later became sick and stayed in Settu.
April, 777 - Imaemishi received Setto once again and departed; however, he later became sick and stayed in Settu.

sen.j: 副使の小野石根が大使の任務を代行。
sen.e: Vice envoy, ONO no Iwane was selected for this task instead.
Vice envoy, ONO no Iwane was selected for this task instead.
Vice envoy, ONO no Iwane was selected for this task instead.

sen.j: 今毛人は左大弁を辞して静養。
sen.e: Imaemishi quitted his job as Sadaiben (Controller of the Left) to rest for the sake of his health.
Imaemishi quitted his job as Sadaiben (Controller of the Left) to rest for the sake of his health.
Imaemishi quitted his job as Sadaiben (Controller of the Left) to rest for the sake of his health.

sen.j: 宝亀10年(779年) - 大宰大弐に補任され大宰府に赴任。
sen.e: 779 - He was appointed as Dazainodaini and moved to Dazaifu.
779 - He was appointed as Dazainodaini and moved to Dazaifu.
779 - He was appointed as Dazainodaini and moved to Dazaifu.

sen.j: 天応元年(781年) - 正四位上。
sen.e: 781 - He was promoted to Shoshiinojo (Upper Grade Senior Fourth Rank).
781 - He was promoted to Shoshiinojo (Upper Grade Senior Fourth Rank).
781 - He was promoted to Shoshiinojo (Upper Grade Senior Fourth Rank).

sen.j: 延暦元年(782年) - 帰京して左大弁に再任され大和国守兼任。
sen.e: 782 - He came back from Dazaifu and reappointed as Sadaiben (Controller of the Left) and held a concurrent position of the Governor of Yamato Province.
782 - He came back from Dazaifu and reappointed as Sadaiben (Controller of the Left) and held a concurrent position of the Governor of Yamato Province.
782 - He came back from Dazaifu and reappointed as Sadaiben (Controller of the Left) and held a concurrent position of the Governor of Yamato Province.

sen.j: 同年従三位。
sen.e: He was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in the same year.
He was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in the same year.
He was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in the same year.

sen.j: 延暦2年(783年) - 皇后宮大夫兼任。
sen.e: 783 - He held a concurrent position of Kogogu-Daibu.
783 - He held a concurrent position of Kogogu-Daibu.
783 - He held a concurrent position of Kogogu-Daibu.

sen.j: 延暦3年(784年) - 桓武天皇は山城国長岡京の地に遷都を計画。
sen.e: 784 - Emperor Kanmu planned the transfer of the national capital to Nagaoka-Kyo in Yamashiro Province.
784 - Emperor Kanmu planned the transfer of the national capital to Nagaoka-Kyo in Yamashiro Province.
784 - Emperor Kanmu planned the transfer of the national capital to Nagaoka-Kyo in Yamashiro Province.

sen.j: 今毛人は同地を視察し、造長岡宮使に任じられる。
sen.e: Imaemish checked the place and was assigned as the Director for the Construction of Nagaoka-kyo Palace.
Imaemish checked the place and was assigned as the Director for the Construction of Nagaoka-kyo Palace.
Imaemish checked the place and was assigned as the Director for the Construction of Nagaoka-kyo Palace.

sen.j: 同年、参議に補任。
sen.e: He was appointed to the Councilor in the same year.
He was appointed to the Councilor in the same year.

sen.j: 延暦4年(785年) - 正三位。
sen.e: 785 - He was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
785 - He was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
785 - He was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).

sen.j: 民部省兼任。
sen.e: He held a concurrent position in the Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs).
He held a concurrent position in the Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs).
He held a concurrent position in the Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs).

sen.j: 延暦5年(786年) - 大宰帥兼任。
sen.e: 786 - He held a concurrent position of Dazai no sochi.
786 - He held a concurrent position as Dazai no sochi.
786 - He held a concurrent position as Dazai no sochi.

sen.j: 延暦8年(789年) - 致仕（骸骨を賜ること）を上表。
sen.e: 789 - He announced to retire a government post (to receive a skeleton).
sen.cmt: （骸骨を賜ること）の意味が不明
sen.e: 789 - He announced his retirement from a government post (to receive a skeleton).
789 - He announced his retirement from a government post (to receive a skeleton).

sen.j: 延暦9年(790年) - 死去。
sen.e: 790 - He died.

sen.j: 享年72。
sen.e: He was 72 years old.
